Description: Molecular glues and heterobifunctional small molecules continue to advance the promise of targeted protein degradation research for drug discovery. Chemically-induced biomolecule proximity, however, presents a considerably broader therapeutic opportunity than protein degradation. Molecular glues mediate protein-protein interactions that neofunctionalize targets yielding diverse biological effects. Heterobifunctional molecules have been designed to hijack an emerging list of enzymes to systematically modulate targets in distinct ways. This educational session will cover this next phase of induced proximity research, and we will discuss the prospects and challenges of these emerging pharmacological modalities for cancer drug discovery.
SearchResultBody: ED040. Chemistry to the Clinic: Part 2 of 3: Leveraging Induced Proximity - Beyond Targeted Protein Degradation
Title: Chemistry to the Clinic: Part 2 of 3: Leveraging Induced Proximity - Beyond Targeted Protein Degradation
